marklogic.body: I have Always liked beef wellington-another different way is to rub the tenderloin in pepper and salt, sear in olive oil in a hot pan, remove from the Heat, add butter, garlic cloves fresh thyme then pop it in the oven until med-rare.....you do need to baste it every 15 min and turn half way through, I usually use a smaller cut (chateaubriand) but it is a great and different way to cook a good cut of beef, and the garlic cloves become so sweet....yummy
